external_references.description: Mac Threat Response, Mobile Research Team. (2020, August 13). The XCSSET Malware: Inserts Malicious Code Into Xcode Projects, Performs UXSS Backdoor Planting in Safari, and Leverages Two Zero-day Exploits. Retrieved October 5, 2021.
Microsoft Threat Intelligence. (2025, March 11). New XCSSET malware adds new obfuscation, persistence techniques to infect Xcode projects. Retrieved April 2, 2025.

objects.description: In older versions, [XCSSET](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0658) uses the plutil command to modify the LSUIElement, DFBundleDisplayName, and CFBundleIdentifier keys in the /Contents/Info.plist file to change how [XCSSET](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0658) is visible on the system. In later versions, [XCSSET](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0658) leverages a third-party notarized `dockutil` tool to modify the `.plist` file responsible for presenting applications to the user in the Dock and LaunchPad to point to a malicious application.(Citation: trendmicro xcsset xcode project 2020)(Citation: Microsoft March 2025 XCSSET)
